skillTree.name: Political Warfare
skillTree.description: ''What has Marienburg to gain with a war with Reikland? Nothing. What has Marienburg to gain with a weakened Reikland? Everything.''

effects.description:
Mission: ''Bridge over the River Reik''
	Note: If requirements are already met the mission will auto succeed.
For the sum of 2000 gold, arranges  Empire Rebels to target rivalrous power  Reikland on the border with Marienburg

skillTree.name: The Game of Thrones
skillTree.description: ''The Golden Rule of business: Never let a good opportunity go to waste. With a weakened Reikland, we could enforce our taxes along the River Reik and perhaps, maybe, throughout the entire Empire..''.

effects.description: For the sum of 4000 gold, arranges a large force of  Empire Rebels to target rivalrous power  Reikland at Altdorf

skillTree.name: Imported Kislevite Noble Steed
skillTree.description: This horse was a gift from Kislevite Nobles with outstanding debts to the Van de Kuypers. It is rumoured the drabes that decorate this fine horse alone cost over a fortune. Intended or not, it's a sight to be hold that inspires friendly troops.

skillTree.name: Marienburg Finery
skillTree.description: Only the finest wares for men who serve the Van de Kuypers. They lavish on wine from the far corners of the Old World and Jaan will always combine his travels with accumulating more oddities, rarities and antiquities.

skillTree.name: Guild Taxes
skillTree.description: There is no more complex tax-system in the Old World than that employed by the Marienburger Directorate. It is so complex even, that there are only a handful of people that understand its working. Van de Kuypers is one of them.

skillTree.name: Expanded Hulls
skillTree.description: A new technology in ship building, invented by the ship builders of Marienburg, is to create deeper hulls without the loss of manoeuvrability or speed. This allows the Merchant fleet of Marienburg to carry more cargo.

skillTree.name: Mare Liberum
skillTree.description: The seas are governed by none. Mare Liberum is the declaration of the free seas, which is nothing more than a excuse to act without the boundaries known as laws and ethics.

effects.description:
Increased plunder from encounters at sea
	(factionwide)

skillTree.name: Mentor
skillTree.description: Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +15% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +20%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +30% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +35%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +50% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +50%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)

skillTree.name: Artisan Economy
skillTree.description: There is no trade without tradeable produce. In order to build a thriving and buzzling empire of trade, one needs to master the art of production. Artisans out of Marienburg have expertly learned how to standardize and perfectionize their craft.

skillTree.name: Imported Armory
skillTree.description: Van de Kuypers has interest in all sorts of rarities known to the Old and New World a like. Although no fighter by any means, his expensive exotic and imported equipment would suit that of a revered hero.

skillTree.name: Key to the Stadsraad
skillTree.description: The Stadsraad is the ''democratic'' house of Marienburg. The Stadsraad is the building occupied by the two houses of the Wasteland's parliament. Al though democratic at first glance, it's noticeable Jaan has never lost a vote.

effects.description: Grants Jaan the Staddtholder of Marienburg follower
Construction time: -2 for Province Capital/Settlement buildings

skillTree.name: Globetrotter
skillTree.description: During his younger years Jaan has seen his fair share of seas. He was one of the first to explore a trade route with the far new world of Lustria, besting storms and reefs along the way.

effects.description:
Experience gain: +20% when fighting at sea
	(all armies factionwide)

Immune to High Seas, Reef and Storm attrition
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.name: The Vloedmuur
skillTree.description: Marienburg is located in the Wastelands, or ''Low-Lands''. These lands are below sea level. The Vloedmuur, or ''floodwall'', is one of the strongest defense mechanics employed by these Lowlanders. They simple breach a few dams and literally flood their lands. Forcing hostile forces on the retreat, or at the very least a slower advance.

effects.description:
Campaign movement range: -20%
	(enemy armies in local province)

skillTree.name: Maritime Deterrence
skillTree.description: Marienburg's navy is listest among the most powerful fleets of the world. A common military strategy employed by Marienburg is deploying relatively close to the shoreline. They use their powerful frigates to bombard enemy land forces from the sea.

skillTree.name: The Mighty Zegepraal
skillTree.description: The flagship of the Marienburger Navy, the mighty Zegepraal. It's mere sight causes both pirate and privateer to tremble. For Jaan it's just one of the few recently purchased assets for House Van de Kuypers.

effects.description:
Post-battle loot: +50% when fighting at sea
	(factionwide)

Melee defence: +10 when fighting at sea
	(all units in army)

Melee attack: +12 when fighting at sea
	(all units in army)

skillTree.name: Tradesmen & Diplomat
skillTree.description: Gold makes the world go round. Jaan knows how to use wealth to influence diplomacy and geo-politics. He has many friends, yet even more enemies.

skillTree.name: Averlander Corn
skillTree.description: A specialty from the rich lands of Averland, the Mad Count Leitdorf offers Jaan a monopoly position when it comes to importing Averlander Corn. The count might be unpredicatable, his corn is worth it's weight in literal gold.

skillTree.name: Ostlander Pork
skillTree.description: Ostlander pork belly is not only Jaan's favorite, it's also distinguishly exported by Osterlander Elector Count Von Raukov. Not just a valuable trade opportunity, Osterland would also account for a powerful military ally in Marienburg's expansionistic views.

skillTree.name: Tilean Wine
skillTree.description: The finest wines hail from the Southern Lands of Tilea. Although Jaan often calls Miragliano the poor man's Marienburg, it is undisputably important to establish a position within it's complex market.

skillTree.name: Estalian Cloth
skillTree.description: Exotic cloths in lavish colours hailing from the distant lands of Estalia, perfectly suitable for Marienburger upper class citizens. Opening up trade with these rich lands opens up new venues of business opportunities.

skillTree.name: Kislevite Furs
skillTree.description: Ever since the Great Orthodoxy took rule over the former trade hub that is Erengrad there is less room for the open-market. Many traders from these cold lands could be persuaded to settle in Marienburg, making this shift of power beneficial.

effects.description: Arranges Trade Agreement with  The Great Orthodoxy

skillTree.name: Norscan Pelts
skillTree.description: Trading with Norscan tribes is considered controversial and non-ethical by most, as one can never ask too many questions as to how these products are aquired. For Jaan they represent nothing but opportunities.

skillTree.name: Global Web of Commerce
skillTree.description: In all four corners, the business of Marienburg is.. Business.

effects.description: Using his global influence, Van de Kuypers imports and exports products from all corners of the world. Arranges Trade Agreements with   ,  ,  and

skillTree.name: Goudberg Estate
skillTree.description:
Jaan despises the thought of long expeditions or hard fought battles at his age. He knows where best to serve his purpose. Not in some far away land but instead right below the New Palace, in the heart of the rich Marienburg district known as Goudberg, in the lavish manor of House Van de Kuypers. It is there where Jaan is most effective, controlling his global web of relations. In his villa wuth Tilean fluted columns and Nulner statues of Winged Victory mingled with gargoyles and faux-battlements from the time of the War of Independence. It is there where lies the true heart of his power.
	
	Note: All the bonusses unlocked in this skill line only apply when Jaan is garrisoned in Marienburg.

effects.description:
Upkeep: -70% while garrisoned in Marienburg
	(all units in army)

skillTree.name: Guild's Liege Lord
skillTree.description: How independent are the Merchants of Marienburg truly if not one of them can strike a bargain without Van de Kuyper's blessing?

effects.description: Income from trade tariffs: +20% when garrisoned in Marienburg

skillTree.name: Nuln Imports
skillTree.description: From his Goudberg Estate, Jaan maintains close relations with Countess Von Liebwitz. Not just because of her aptitude for trade, no - mostly because of the prodcut her State specializes in: Armaments.

effects.description:
Ammunition: +10% for Marienburg ranged units
	(Lord's army)

Missile strength: +6% for Marienburg ranged units
	(Lord's army)
Half of this value will affect forces factionwide when Jaan is garrisoned in Marienburg

skillTree.name: Strompoort's Investor
skillTree.description: Paranoid as he is, Jaan insists the Strompoort to be occupied by double shifts when he is present in the City.

effects.description:
Physical resistance: 6% for Marienburg units
	(Lord's army)
Half of this value will affect forces factionwide when Jaan is garrisoned in Marienburg

skillTree.name: Meddling with the Masons
skillTree.description: Jaan's grandeur vision of Marienburg stands and falls by the willingness of the masonry to construct his projects. Some bribing won't harm anyone, and benefit the province as a whole.

effects.description:
Construction time: -15% for all buildings when garrisoned in Marienburg
	(factionwide)

skillTree.name: State Army's Benefactor
skillTree.description: Although not militaristic oriented, the Van de Kuypers value the State Army. As he knows it is the only thing that stands between indepedence and annexation. Jaan invests personally to ensure the Marienburger army is fitted to Empiric standards.

effects.description: Melee defence: +4 for Marienburg infantry units
Melee attack: +4 for Marienburg infantry units
Half of this value will affect forces factionwide when Jaan is garrisoned in Marienburg

skillTree.name: Bridges, Dams and Delta's
skillTree.description: The Wastelanders specialize in the construction of bridges and dams, being forced to - as the ''Low-Lands'' are situated well below sea level. It allows them to traverse the marshes with ease.

effects.description:
Campaign movement range: +8% when garrisoned in Marienburg
	(all armies)

skillTree.name: Verena and the Great Library
skillTree.description: Marienburg houses one of the greatest Libraries of the Old World, it's collection ever expanding. One only need one guess to find out who the main benefactor is.

effects.description: Research rate: +15% when garrisoned in Marienburg

skillTree.name: Jaan's Stable
skillTree.description: A long the Gilded Route sail the extrovert Merchant Lords of Marienburg. Most of which do so for the Van de Kuyper's family, where those who bear Jaan's sigil are protected from most taxes.

effects.description:
Maximum cargo capacity: +15% for caravans when garrisoned in Marienburg
	(all characters)
Ability: "Van de Kuyper's Sigil" for Merchant Lords when garrisoned in Marienburg

skillTree.name: Major Shareholder
skillTree.description: The Merchant Guild's autonomy is a farce. Every tenth shilling is reserved for Van de Kuypers. As they control regulations, trade laws and edicts. Leeching from all profits made by others.

effects.description:
Treasury gained from foreign Caravans: +100% when garrisoned in Marienburg
	(local region)
Melee attack: +12 for Lords and embedded Heroes
Melee defence: +12 for Lords and embedded Heroes

skillTree.name: Bread and Games
skillTree.description: "If you keep them dumb, I'll keep them poor''. - Jaan van de Kuypers to the Generals and admirals of the Marienburg State Army.

effects.description:
Lord recruit rank: +5 when garrisoned in Marienburg
	(factionwide)

skillTree.name: Global Importeur
skillTree.description: Most Generals are on the Van de Kuypers paylist, performing a reversed schorch earth doctrine on their campaigns, claiming valueble trade produce from the lands they find themselves in to benefit the Van de Kuyper's venture.

effects.description: At the start of the next turn, a random General will gain 'Tradable resource production: +50%' (local region) if Jaan is garrisoned in Marienburg

skillTree.name: House Van de Kuypers
skillTree.description: The van de Kuypers are by far the richest and most powerful of the Ten Great Families of Marienburg. Clawing their way to power before Marienburg's independence through sharp, brutal business dealings. They are the true leaders of the Directorate: through their web of clients and contacts, they commands a block of eight votes.

effects.description: Ability: "Backroom Politics'' for all Lords when garrisoned in Marienburg

target_if: Leadership is lower than 50% of base
Unit is a Lord or Hero

skillTree.name: Route Marcher
skillTree.description: Those who know the land and its secrets will travel faster and further than the foes who don't.

skillTree.name: Iron Disciplinarian
skillTree.description: This Lord expects utter obedience from the smallfolk, and has little time for insurrections or petty revolts.

skillTree.name: Leader of Renown
skillTree.description: Revered by the masses, such a celebrated leader will inspire many new recruits.

skillTree.name: Reassuring Presence
skillTree.description: The presence of this Lord ensures a measure of calm, reducing panic and desertion amongst followers.

effects.description:
Attrition: -10% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -20% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -30% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.name: Fervent
skillTree.description: Through our acts, the gods will cleanse the lands.

skillTree.name: Irrepressible
skillTree.description: It is said that Sigmar would bear a mortal wound and carry on fighting; this champion follows the hallowed Warrior-God.

effects.description:
Casualty replenishment rate: +30% for this Lord
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.name: Quartermaster
skillTree.description: A good quartermaster can ration equipment and foodstuffs efficiently, making supplies last longer.

skillTree.name: Logistician
skillTree.description: Proficient with figures, this Lord, or his subordinates, can keep his army fulfilled, even in dire circumstances.

skillTree.name: Alert
skillTree.description: Countless conflicts and a keen sense of awareness have made this Lord difficult to entrap.

effects.description: Chance of intercepting an army using the Underway, beast-paths or Worldroots: +5%
Chance of intercepting an army using the Underway, beast-paths or Worldroots: +10%

skillTree.name: Lightning Strike
skillTree.description: "The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present

skillTree.name: Headhunter
skillTree.description: "Ever thought about joining the Elector's troops, chief? You'd make a good soldier alright."

backgroundSkills.name: Richest man alive
backgroundSkills.description: Old Van de Kuypers does not lead from the front, but instead from the backrooms of the many estates in Marienburg. He leaves the conquering to Emperors, Tsars, Nobles and High-Kings. And what do those all have in common? They all owe money to Jaan van de Kuypers.

effects.description: Jaan van de Kuypers demands a percentage of experience earned by other Lords when garrisoned in Marienburg

Leadership: +1 for every arranged trade agreement
	(all units in army)

target_if: Unit is a Lord or Hero

items.name: Van der Maacht's Hat
items.description: Paulus van der Maacht was the last Baron of Westerland. He died without heirs whilst serving the Imperial Emperor. All rulers afterwards are simply acting regents "until a true heir to the House of van de Maacht can be found". Of course, the wealthiest families make sure this never happens. The Directorate is careful to see that no one can meet the conditions. Van der Maacht's possessions are instead used as symbolic tokens of power as the wielders derive legitimacy for their influence by calling themselves the owner of items previously wielded by Van der Maacht. The most important and magical of these items was the Ceremonial Hat of Westerland, this luxurious item was wielded by the Elector Count of Westerland. With pompous feathers and gems it is a sight to be hold and it's worth it's weight in gold.

items.name: Jaan's Lucky Coin
items.description: Jaan has always shown great interest in the various trinkets and oddities that come from the New World. He has shown a particular interest in anything Lustrian. This gold trinket, that resembles the shape of a coin, is said to never leave Jaan's pocket. His advisors convinced him it is blessed by the good God Haeyndrik himself, in truth they know the magical powers it radiates has nothing to do with powers the of the order Gods, but instead radiates something far more sinister.

items.name: Key to the Stadsraad
items.description: Symbolically, the stadtholder holds both the key to Marienburg's parliament buildings and, not so symbolically, the real levers of power in the province.

factionEffects.title: The Marienburg Directorate
factionEffects.description: Jaan van de Kuypers, the true Lord of the Marienburg Directorate and the Richest man Alive, seeks to consolidate his power within the halls of the Stadsraad and far beyond.

effects.description: The Merchant Empire: Has no access to Elector State regiments but instead has access to unique Marienburg Rites & Units
Send trade convoys across the world via the Gilded Route and navigate risks en route to reap great financial rewards
